newsitem.title: USA: AMRE defers, restructures HFS payments.
newsitem.headline: AMRE defers, restructures HFS payments.

text.p: AMRE Inc said Tuesday it has reached an agreement in principle with HFS Inc to defer $9.6 million of its 1996 royalty obligation to HFS.
The agreement also allows AMRE to modify its $11.0 million 1997 royalty payment and to restructure the terms of future royalty payments, AMRE said.
In addition, AMRE said, it has agreed to end its existing $4.0 million line of credit with HFS.

AMRE, the parent company of Century 21 Home Improvements Inc, said the moves will significantly cut its need for working capital. The company said it continues to cut fixed costs and seek options for raising additional capital.
